name: sunflower production | sunflower seed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15253/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of sunflower grains, at standard water content required for storage (9%). The average yield from 2006 - 2010 is 2.4 t/ha. The data are representative for conventional sunflower seed production in France, considering an average of irrigated and non-irrigated fields, used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 41-25-22 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 1 m3/ha of liquid manure and 2.8 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 3.24 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of sunflower produced in France amounts to 11% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing sunflower produced in France for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.3 (i.e. excellent quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with the harvest of sunflowers and their transport to the farm gate. The dataset includes all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, pesticide and fertilizer application, harvesting, and on-farm transport. Drying is not applied systematically (assumption 10% of yield is dried). Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.  Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period referring to the data source: 2006-2010. Based on expert opinion data is considered to be valid at least up to 2012.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L3; Machinery: L4; Irrigation: L3. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

Calculated value: The total amount of water used for irrigation (Terres Inovia 2006, 2009) multiplied by the country-share of irrigation technique (WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf, Appendix 6.1). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Water use for irrigation' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). 4% of the area is irrigated. The amount of water apllied on irrigated fields amounts to 600 m3/ha. This results in 24 m3/ha when considering an average of irrigated and non-irrigated sunflower fields.

exchanges.description:
Comment on mathematicalRelation:
-4.03116182573e-06 from Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.
-4.9595e-07 from Crop, default, heavy metals uptake model
Heavy metal uptake can be excluded by setting the parameter heavyMetalUptakeSwitch to zero.
Calculated value - 100% emission in soil. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'sunflower seed' is calculated to be circa 3.63E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 7.26E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

exchanges.description: Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of sunflower seed is calculated to be circa 1.34E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[sulfonyl]urea-compound', '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'aclonifen', 'cyclic N-compound', 'diazole-compound', 'glyphosate', 'metaldehyde', 'metolachlor', 'pendimethalin', 'phenoxy-compound', 'pyrethroid-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.68E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
